column1: Trochanteric bursitis occurs when the bursa in your hip becomes swollen and irritated.

Trochanteric bursitis can be caused by: - Overuse or stress on the hip from exercising or standing for long periods - Hip injury, such as from a fall - Having one leg that is longer than the other - Bone spurs on the hip - Spine problems, including scoliosis and arthritis of the spine - Muscle imbalance that puts more stress around the hip muscles - Infection (rare) Certain health problems can also cause hip bursitis, including: - Rheumatoid arthritis - Gout - Pseudogout - Diabetes - Thyroid disease Bursitis is more common in older adults.
Being out of shape or overweight may put you at greater risk for hip bursitis.
- Take pain relievers such as ibuprofen (Advil, Motrin) or naproxen (Aleve, Naprosyn) to help relieve pain and swelling.
